alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 3:44PM EST until March 09 at 1:18AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mahoning River At Warren. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, River is out of banks, southern portions of South Park Road threatened. Flooding can be expected at Walnut and Beaver, along South Park Avenue and along Hayden Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EST Tuesday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.0 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 05/23/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 130 AM EST.
